## PICO

[P]{style="color:red;"}[I]{style="color:green;"}[C]{style="color:blue;"}[O]{style="color:purple;"} [Population]{style="color:red;"} [Intervention]{style="color:green;"} [Comparator]{style="color:blue;"} [Outcome]{style="color:purple;"}

Example: What is the effect of [daily school meals]{style="color:green;"} on [primary school children]{style="color:red;"} compared to [no meal provision]{style="color:blue;"} in improving [school attendance]{style="color:purple;"}?

## PECO

PECO – Exposure (non-randomised) Questions

[P]{style="color:red;"}[E]{style="color:green;"}[C]{style="color:blue;"}[O]{style="color:purple;"} [Population]{style="color:red;"} [Exposure]{style="color:green;"} [Comparator]{style="color:blue;"} [Outcome]{style="color:purple;"}

Example: What is the effect of [living in food-insecure households]{style="color:green;"} on [children under 5]{style="color:red;"} compared to [food-secure households]{style="color:blue;"} in terms of [nutritional status]{style="color:purple;"}?

## PO

PO – Prevalence/Descriptive Questions

[P]{style="color:red;"}[O]{style="color:purple;"} [Population]{style="color:red;"} [Outcome]{style="color:purple;"}

Example: What is the [prevalence of anemia]{style="color:purple;"} in [school-aged children in rural Kenya]{style="color:red;"}?

## PIT

PIT – Diagnostic Accuracy

[P]{style="color:red;"}[I]{style="color:green;"}[T]{style="color:blue;"} [Population]{style="color:red;"} [Index test]{style="color:green;"} [Target condition]{style="color:blue;"}

Example: What is the accuracy of [household food insecurity surveys]{style="color:green;"} in detecting [moderate or severe food insecurity]{style="color:blue;"} among [adolescent girls in low-income urban areas]{style="color:red;"}?

## SPICE

SPICE – for service delivery and policy evaluations

[S]{style="color:red;"}[P]{style="color:green;"}[I]{style="color:blue;"}[C]{style="color:purple;"}[E]{style="color:orange;"} [Setting]{style="color:red;"} [Population]{style="color:green;"} [Intervention]{style="color:blue;"} [Comparison]{style="color:purple;"} [Evaluation]{style="color:orange;"}

Example: In [public schools in Malawi]{style="color:red;"}, how does [providing breakfast and lunch]{style="color:blue;"} to [primary school students]{style="color:green;"} compare to [lunch only]{style="color:purple;"} in terms of [learning outcomes and enrollment]{style="\"color:orange;"}?

## Your Turn

Try framing these using PICO/PECO/SPICE (intervention, exposure, or service delivery):

Does the frequency of school meals influence academic performance among students in rural Ethiopia?

How does household income level affect children's access to school feeding programs in urban India?

What is the prevalence of underweight children in regions with and without school feeding programs?

In low-income countries, what are the effects of take-home rations compared to in-school feeding on girls’ school attendance?

## Why do we do this?

It aids in structuring the search (we will talk more about this tomorrow)

From PICO to Search Strategy:

Let’s say your question is:\
**“What is the effect of school feeding programs on child nutrition in low- and middle-income countries?”**

We can translate each PICO element into searchable terms

## 

| **PICO** | **What it means** | **Example search terms** |
|---------------|---------------|-------------------------------------------|
| **P** | Population | children<br>students |
| **I** | Intervention | school feeding<br>school meals<br> |
| **C** | Comparator (optional) | no feeding<br>before and after<br> |
| **O** | Outcome | nutrition<br>stunting<br>growth<br>malnutrition |

## 

Then **combine the terms** using Boolean logic:

`("school children" OR students OR "primary school") AND ("school feeding" OR "school meal" OR "food program") AND (nutrition OR stunting OR anemia OR malnutrition)`
